<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Ceramic Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=19)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Adjusted Armor Latches" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=468" />
<trait label="Noisy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=205" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 10 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 6 gp

**AC Bonus** +3

**Dex Cap** +2

**Check Penalty** -2

**Speed Penalty** -5 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 14

**Bulk** 2

**Category** Medium

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

Traditional armor from Senghor, ceramic plate alleviates the need for metallurgy and smithing, instead relying on ceramic firing, glazing, and strong cord work with a backing of leather and thick canvas. Ceramic plate that follows Senghor's style is colorful and artistic, and is built with the [armor latches](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1824) armor adjustment.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />
name: Ceramic Plate
